upload.tip: You can upload files, sync from the website, or from webb apps like Notion, GitHub, etc.

metadata.title: Metadata

embedding.previewTip: Paragraph preview will be available after embedding is complete

segment.keywordError: The maximum length of keyword is 20

dataset.externalKnowledgeNamePlaceholder: Please enter the name of the knowledge base
dataset.externalKnowledgeDescriptionPlaceholder: Describe what"s in this Knowledge Base (optional)
dataset.learnHowToWriteGoodKnowledgeDescription: Learn how to write a good knowledge description
dataset.externalAPIPanelDescription: The external knowledge API is used to connect to a knowledge base outside of Dify and retrieve knowledge from that knowledge base.
dataset.externalAPIPanelDocumentation: Learn how to create an External Knowledge API
dataset.createNewExternalAPI: Create a new External Knowledge API
dataset.noExternalKnowledge: There is no External Knowledge API yet, click here to create

editExternalAPIConfirmWarningContent.front: This External Knowledge API is linked to
editExternalAPIConfirmWarningContent.end: external knowledge, and this modification will be applied to all of them. Are you sure you want to save this change?

editExternalAPIFormWarning.front: This External API is linked to

content.front: This External Knowledge API is linked to
content.end: external knowledge. Deleting this API will invalidate all of them. Are you sure you want to delete this API?

deleteExternalAPIConfirmWarningContent.noConnectionContent: Are you sure to delete this API?

dataset.connectDataset: Connect to an External Knowledge Base

connectDatasetIntro.title: How to Connect to an External Knowledge Base

content.front: To connect to an external knowledge base, you need to create an external API first. Please read carefully and refer to
content.link: Learn how to create an external API
content.end: . Then find the corresponding knowledge ID and fill it in the form on the left. If all the information is correct, it will automatically jump to the retrieval test in the knowledge base after clicking the connect button.

connectHelper.helper1: Connect to external knowledge bases via API and knowledge base ID. Currently,
connectHelper.helper2: only the retrieval functionality is supported

dataset.createDatasetIntro: Import your own text data or write data in real-time via Webhook for LLM context enhancement.
dataset.deleteDatasetConfirmContent: Deleting the Knowledge is irreversible. Users will no longer be able to access your Knowledge, and all prompt configurations and logs will be permanently deleted.
dataset.datasetUsedByApp: The knowledge is being used by some apps. Apps will no longer be able to use this Knowledge, and all prompt configurations and logs will be permanently deleted.
dataset.intro1: The Knowledge can be integrated into the Dify application
dataset.intro6: as a standalone ChatGPT index plug-in to publish
dataset.unavailableTip: Embedding model is not available, the default embedding model needs to be configured

encrypted.front: Your API Token will be encrypted and stored using

semantic_search.title: Vector Search
semantic_search.description: Generate query embeddings and search for the text chunk most similar to its vector representation.

full_text_search.title: Full-Text Search
full_text_search.description: Index all terms in the document, allowing users to search any term and retrieve relevant text chunk containing those terms.

hybrid_search.title: Hybrid Search
hybrid_search.description: Execute full-text search and vector searches simultaneously, re-rank to select the best match for the user"s query. Users can choose to set weights or configure to a Rerank model.

invertedIndex.title: Inverted Index
invertedIndex.description: Inverted Index is a structure used for efficient retrieval. Organized by terms, each term points to documents or web pages containing it.

dataset.defaultRetrievalTip: Multi-path retrieval is used by default. Knowledge is retrieved from multiple knowledge bases and then re-ranked.
dataset.mixtureHighQualityAndEconomicTip: The Rerank model is required for mixture of high quality and economical knowledge bases.
dataset.inconsistentEmbeddingModelTip: The Rerank model is required if the Embedding models of the selected knowledge bases are inconsistent.
dataset.mixtureInternalAndExternalTip: The Rerank model is required for mixture of internal and  external knowledge.
dataset.allExternalTip: When using external knowledge only, the user can choose whether to enable the Rerank model. If not enabled, retrieved chunks will be sorted based on scores. When the retrieval strategies of different knowledge bases are inconsistent, it will be inaccurate.

weightedScore.title: Weighted Score
weightedScore.description: By adjusting the weights assigned, this rerank strategy determines whether to prioritize semantic or keyword matching.

dataset.nTo1RetrievalLegacy: N-to-1 retrieval will be officially deprecated from September. It is recommended to use the latest Multi-path retrieval to obtain better results.
dataset.nTo1RetrievalLegacyLinkText: N-to-1 retrieval will be officially deprecated in September.

firecrawl.getApiKeyLinkText: Get your API key from firecrawl.dev

jinaReader.getApiKeyLinkText: Get your free API key at jina.ai

validation.filesNumber: You have reached the batch upload limit of {{filesNumber}}.

stepOne.notionSyncTip: To sync with Notion, connection to Notion must be established first.
stepOne.emptyDatasetCreation: I want to create an empty Knowledge

modal.title: Create an empty Knowledge
modal.tip: An empty Knowledge will contain no documents, and you can upload documents any time.
modal.nameLengthInvalid: Name must be between 1 to 40 characters

website.fireCrawlNotConfiguredDescription: Configure Firecrawl with API key to use it.
website.jinaReaderNotConfiguredDescription: Set up Jina Reader by entering your free API key for access.
website.jinaReaderTitle: Convert the entire site to Markdown
website.useSitemapTooltip: Follow the sitemap to crawl the site. If not, Jina Reader will crawl iteratively based on page relevance, yielding fewer but higher-quality pages.
website.extractOnlyMainContent: Extract only main content (no headers, navs, footers, etc.)
website.exceptionErrorTitle: An exception occurred while running crawling job:
website.maxDepthTooltip: Maximum depth to crawl relative to the entered URL. Depth 0 just scrapes the page of the entered url, depth 1 scrapes the url and everything after enteredURL + one /, and so on.

stepTwo.autoDescription: Automatically set chunk and preprocessing rules. Unfamiliar users are recommended to select this.
stepTwo.customDescription: Customize chunks rules, chunks length, and preprocessing rules, etc.
stepTwo.separatorTip:
A delimiter is the character used to separate text. 

 and 
 are commonly used delimiters for separating paragraphs and lines. Combined with commas (

,
), paragraphs will be segmented by lines when exceeding the maximum chunk length. You can also use special delimiters defined by yourself (e.g. ***).
stepTwo.separatorPlaceholder:
for separating paragraphs; 
 for separating lines
stepTwo.maxLengthCheck: Maximum chunk length should be less than 4000
stepTwo.overlapTip: Setting the chunk overlap can maintain the semantic relevance between them, enhancing the retrieve effect. It is recommended to set 10%-25% of the maximum chunk size.
stepTwo.overlapCheck: chunk overlap should not bigger than maximum chunk length
stepTwo.removeExtraSpaces: Replace consecutive spaces, newlines and tabs
stepTwo.removeUrlEmails: Delete all URLs and email addresses
stepTwo.qualifiedTip: Call default system embedding interface for processing to provide higher accuracy when users query.
stepTwo.warning: Please set up the model provider API key first.
stepTwo.economicalTip: Use offline vector engines, keyword indexes, etc. to reduce accuracy without spending tokens
stepTwo.QATip: Enable this option will consume more tokens
stepTwo.sideTipP1: When processing text data, chunk and cleaning are two important preprocessing steps.
stepTwo.sideTipP2: Segmentation splits long text into paragraphs so models can understand better. This improves the quality and relevance of model results.
stepTwo.sideTipP3: Cleaning removes unnecessary characters and formats, making Knowledge cleaner and easier to parse.
stepTwo.sideTipP4: Proper chunk and cleaning improve model performance, providing more accurate and valuable results.
stepTwo.previewSwitchTipStart: The current chunk preview is in text format, switching to a question-and-answer format preview will
stepTwo.indexSettingTip: To change the index method & embedding model, please go to the
stepTwo.retrievalSettingTip: To change the retrieval setting, please go to the

stepThree.creationContent: We automatically named the Knowledge, you can modify it at any time
stepThree.label: Knowledge name
stepThree.additionP1: The document has been uploaded to the Knowledge
stepThree.additionP2: , you can find it in the document list of the Knowledge.
stepThree.sideTipContent: After the document finishes indexing, the Knowledge can be integrated into the application as context, you can find the context setting in the prompt orchestration page. You can also create it as an independent ChatGPT indexing plugin for release.
stepThree.modelTitle: Are you sure to stop embedding?
stepThree.modelContent: If you need to resume processing later, you will continue from where you left off.

settings.desc: Here you can modify the properties and retrieval settings of this Knowledge.

form.name: Knowledge Name

form.descWrite: Learn how to write a good Knowledge description.

form.indexMethodEconomyTip: Use offline vector engines, keyword indexes, etc. to reduce accuracy without spending tokens

element.title: Is anyone there?
element.content: Observe and annotate interactions between end-users and AI applications here to continuously improve AI accuracy. You can try <shareLink>sharing</shareLink> or <testLink>testing</testLink> the Web App yourself, then return to this page.

customize.title: Customize AI WebApp
customize.explanation: You can customize the frontend of the Web App to fit your scenario and style needs.

way1.name: Fork the client code, modify it and deploy to Vercel (recommended)

totalConversations.title: Total Conversations
totalConversations.explanation: Daily AI conversations count; prompt engineering/debugging excluded.

activeUsers.title: Active Users
activeUsers.explanation: Unique users engaging in Q&A with AI; prompt engineering/debugging excluded.

tokenUsage.title: Token Usage
tokenUsage.explanation: Reflects the daily token usage of the language model for the application, useful for cost control purposes.

avgSessionInteractions.title: Avg. Session Interactions
avgSessionInteractions.explanation: Continuous user-AI communication count; for conversation-based apps.

avgUserInteractions.title: Avg. User Interactions
avgUserInteractions.explanation: Reflects the daily usage frequency of users. This metric reflects user stickiness.

userSatisfactionRate.title: User Satisfaction Rate
userSatisfactionRate.explanation: The number of likes per 1,000 messages. This indicates the proportion of answers that users are highly satisfied with.

avgResponseTime.title: Avg. Response Time
avgResponseTime.explanation: Time (ms) for AI to process/respond; for text-based apps.

tps.title: Token Output Speed
tps.explanation: Measure the performance of the LLM. Count the Tokens output speed of LLM from the beginning of the request to the completion of the output.

annotation.title: Annotations
annotation.name: Annotation Reply

noData.title: No annotations
noData.description: You can edit annotations during app debugging or import annotations in bulk here for a high-quality response.

annotation.embeddingModelSwitchTip: Annotation text vectorization model, switching models will be re-embedded, resulting in additional costs.

app.deleteAppConfirmContent: Deleting the app is irreversible. Users will no longer be able to access your app, and all prompt configurations and logs will be permanently deleted.
app.communityIntro: Discuss with team members, contributors and developers on different channels.

newApp.captionAppType: What type of app do you want to create?
newApp.chatbotDescription: Build a chat-based application. This app uses a question-and-answer format, allowing for multiple rounds of continuous conversation.
newApp.completionDescription: Build an application that generates high-quality text based on prompts, such as generating articles, summaries, translations, and more.
newApp.completionWarning: This type of app will no longer be supported.
newApp.agentDescription: Build an intelligent Agent which can autonomously choose tools to complete the tasks
newApp.workflowDescription: Build an application that generates high-quality text based on workflow orchestrates with a high degree of customization. It is suitable for experienced users.
newApp.basicTip: For beginners, can switch to Chatflow later
newApp.basicDescription: Basic Orchestrate allows for the orchestration of a Chatbot app using simple settings, without the ability to modify built-in prompts. It is suitable for beginners.
newApp.advancedDescription: Workflow Orchestrate orchestrates Chatbots in the form of workflows, offering a high degree of customization, including the ability to edit built-in prompts. It is suitable for experienced users.
newApp.appDescriptionPlaceholder: Enter the description of the app
newApp.chatAppIntro: I want to build a chat-based application. This app uses a question-and-answer format, allowing for multiple rounds of continuous conversation.
newApp.completeAppIntro: I want to create an application that generates high-quality text based on prompts, such as generating articles, summaries, translations, and more.
newApp.showTemplates: I want to choose from a template
newApp.appCreateDSLWarning: Caution: DSL version difference may affect certain features
newApp.appCreateDSLErrorPart1: A significant difference in DSL versions has been detected. Forcing the import may cause the application to malfunction.

answerIcon.description: Whether to use the WebApp icon to replace ðŸ¤– in the shared application

tracing.title: Tracing app performance
tracing.description: Configuring a Third-Party LLMOps provider and tracing app performance.
tracing.tracingDescription: Capture the full context of app execution, including LLM calls, context, prompts, HTTP requests, and more, to a third-party tracing platform.

langsmith.title: LangSmith
langsmith.description: An all-in-one developer platform for every step of the LLM-powered application lifecycle.

langfuse.title: Langfuse
langfuse.description: Traces, evals, prompt management and metrics to debug and improve your LLM application.

configProvider.title: Config
configProvider.removeConfirmContent: The current configuration is in use, removing it will turn off the Tracing feature.

apiKeyModal.apiSecretKeyTips: To prevent API abuse, protect your API Key. Avoid using it as plain text in front-end code. :)
apiKeyModal.generateTips: Keep this key in a secure and accessible place.

completionMode.title: Completion App API
completionMode.info: For high-quality text generation, such as articles, summaries, and translations, use the completion-messages API with user input. Text generation relies on the model parameters and prompt templates set in Dify Prompt Engineering.
completionMode.createCompletionApiTip: Create a Completion Message to support the question-and-answer mode.
completionMode.inputsTips: (Optional) Provide user input fields as key-value pairs, corresponding to variables in Prompt Eng. Key is the variable name, Value is the parameter value. If the field type is Select, the submitted Value must be one of the preset choices.
completionMode.blocking: Blocking type, waiting for execution to complete and returning results. (Requests may be interrupted if the process is long)
completionMode.streaming: streaming returns. Implementation of streaming return based on SSE (Server-Sent Events).
completionMode.messageFeedbackApiTip: Rate received messages on behalf of end-users with likes or dislikes. This data is visible in the Logs & Annotations page and used for future model fine-tuning.
completionMode.ratingTip: like or dislike, null is undo
completionMode.parametersApiTip: Retrieve configured Input parameters, including variable names, field names, types, and default values. Typically used for displaying these fields in a form or filling in default values after the client loads.

chatMode.title: Chat App API
chatMode.info: For versatile conversational apps using a Q&A format, call the chat-messages API to initiate dialogue. Maintain ongoing conversations by passing the returned conversation_id. Response parameters and templates depend on Dify Prompt Eng. settings.
chatMode.createChatApiTip: Create a new conversation message or continue an existing dialogue.
chatMode.inputsTips: (Optional) Provide user input fields as key-value pairs, corresponding to variables in Prompt Eng. Key is the variable name, Value is the parameter value. If the field type is Select, the submitted Value must be one of the preset choices.
chatMode.blocking: Blocking type, waiting for execution to complete and returning results. (Requests may be interrupted if the process is long)
chatMode.streaming: streaming returns. Implementation of streaming return based on SSE (Server-Sent Events).
chatMode.conversationIdTip: (Optional) Conversation ID: leave empty for first-time conversation; pass conversation_id from context to continue dialogue.
chatMode.messageFeedbackApiTip: Rate received messages on behalf of end-users with likes or dislikes. This data is visible in the Logs & Annotations page and used for future model fine-tuning.
chatMode.ratingTip: like or dislike, null is undo
chatMode.chatMsgHistoryApiTip: The first page returns the latest `limit` bar, which is in reverse order.
chatMode.chatMsgHistoryFirstId: ID of the first chat record on the current page. The default is none.
chatMode.chatMsgHistoryLimit: How many chats are returned in one request
chatMode.conversationsListApiTip: Gets the session list of the current user. By default, the last 20 sessions are returned.
chatMode.conversationsListFirstIdTip: The ID of the last record on the current page, default none.
chatMode.conversationsListLimitTip: How many chats are returned in one request
chatMode.conversationRenamingApiTip: Rename conversations; the name is displayed in multi-session client interfaces.
chatMode.parametersApiTip: Retrieve configured Input parameters, including variable names, field names, types, and default values. Typically used for displaying these fields in a form or filling in default values after the client loads.

promptMode.simple: Switch to Expert Mode to edit the whole PROMPT

advancedWarning.title: You have switched to Expert Mode, and once you modify the PROMPT, you CANNOT return to the basic mode.
advancedWarning.description: In Expert Mode, you can edit whole PROMPT.

promptMode.contextMissing: Context component missed, the effectiveness of the prompt may not be good.

notSetAPIKey.description: The LLM provider key has not been set, and it needs to be set before debugging.

groupChat.title: Chat enhance
groupChat.description: Add pre-conversation settings for apps can enhance user experience.

conversationOpener.title: Conversation Opener
conversationOpener.description: In a chat app, the first sentence that the AI actively speaks to the user is usually used as a welcome.

suggestedQuestionsAfterAnswer.title: Follow-up
suggestedQuestionsAfterAnswer.description: Setting up next questions suggestion can give users a better chat.

speechToText.title: Speech to Text
speechToText.description: Voice input can be used in chat.

textToSpeech.title: Text to Speech
textToSpeech.description: Conversation messages can be converted to speech.

citation.title: Citations and Attributions
citation.description: Show source document and attributed section of the generated content.

annotation.title: Annotation Reply
annotation.description: You can manually add high-quality response to the cache for prioritized matching with similar user questions.

scoreThreshold.title: Score Threshold
scoreThreshold.description: Used to set the similarity threshold for annotation reply.

dataSet.title: Context
dataSet.noData: You can import Knowledge as context

queryVariable.title: Query variable
queryVariable.tip: This variable will be used as the query input for context retrieval, obtaining context information related to the input of this variable.
queryVariable.noVarTip: please create a variable under the Variables section
queryVariable.unableToQueryDataSetTip: Unable to query the Knowledge successfully, please choose a context query variable in the context section.
queryVariable.contextVarNotEmpty: context query variable can not be empty
queryVariable.deleteContextVarTip: This variable has been set as a context query variable, and removing it will impact the normal use of the Knowledge. If you still need to delete it, please reselect it in the context section.

tools.title: Tools
tools.tips: Tools provide a standard API call method, taking user input or variables as request parameters for querying external data as context.

conversationHistory.title: Conversation History
conversationHistory.description: Set prefix names for conversation roles

moderation.description: Secure model output by using moderation API or maintaining a sensitive word list.

bar.empty: Enable feature to enhance web app user experience

writingsPolisher.name: Writing polisher

debug.promptTip: Prompts guide AI responses with instructions and constraints. Insert variables like {{input}}. This prompt won"t be visible to users.
debug.formattingChangedText: Modifying the formatting will reset the debug area, are you sure?
debug.variableTip: Users fill variables in a form, automatically replacing variables in the prompt.
debug.notSetVar: Variables allow users to introduce prompt words or opening remarks when filling out forms. You can try entering "{{input}}" in the prompt words.
debug.autoAddVar: Undefined variables referenced in pre-prompt, are you want to add them in user input form?

varKeyError.tooLong: {{key}} is too length. Can not be longer then 30 characters
varKeyError.notValid: {{key}} is invalid. Can only contain letters, numbers, and underscores
varKeyError.notStartWithNumber: {{key}} can not start with a number

otherError.historyNoBeEmpty: Conversation history must be set in the prompt
otherError.queryNoBeEmpty: Query must be set in the prompt

variableConfig.notSet: Not set, try typing {{input}} in the prefix prompt

errorMsg.varNameCanBeRepeat: Variable name can not be repeated
errorMsg.atLeastOneOption: At least one option is required

vision.name: Vision
vision.description: Enable Vision will allows the model to take in images and answer questions about them.Â

visionSettings.title: Vision Settings
visionSettings.resolutionTooltip:
low res will allow model receive a low-res 512 x 512 version of the image, and represent the image with a budget of 65 tokens. This allows the API to return faster responses and consume fewer input tokens for use cases that do not require high detail.
      \n
      high res will first allows the model to see the low res image and then creates detailed crops of input images as 512px squares based on the input image size. Each of the detailed crops uses twice the token budget for a total of 129 tokens.

openingStatement.title: Conversation Opener
openingStatement.placeholder: Write your opener message here, you can use variables, try type {{variable}}.
openingStatement.noDataPlaceHolder: Starting the conversation with the user can help AI establish a closer connection with them in conversational applications.
openingStatement.varTip: You can use variables, try type {{variable}}
openingStatement.tooShort: At least 20 words of initial prompt are required to generate an opening remarks for the conversation.
openingStatement.notIncludeKey: The initial prompt does not include the variable: {{key}}. Please add it to the initial prompt.

inputs.title: Debug & Preview
inputs.noPrompt: Try write some prompt in pre-prompt input
inputs.noVar: Fill in the value of the variable, which will be automatically replaced in the prompt word every time a new session is started.
inputs.chatVarTip: Fill in the value of the variable, which will be automatically replaced in the prompt word every time a new session is started
inputs.completionVarTip: Fill in the value of the variable, which will be automatically replaced in the prompt words every time a question is submitted.

datasetConfig.knowledgeTip: Click the â€œ+â€ button to add knowledge

retrieveOneWay.title: N-to-1 retrieval
retrieveOneWay.description: Based on user intent and Knowledge descriptions, the Agent autonomously selects the best Knowledge for querying. Best for applications with distinct, limited Knowledge.

retrieveMultiWay.title: Multi-path retrieval
retrieveMultiWay.description: Based on user intent, queries across all Knowledge, retrieves relevant text from multi-sources, and selects the best results matching the user query after reranking.

datasetConfig.top_kTip: Used to filter chunks that are most similar to user questions. The system will also dynamically adjust the value of Top K, according to max_tokens of the selected model.
datasetConfig.score_thresholdTip: Used to set the similarity threshold for chunks filtering.
datasetConfig.retrieveChangeTip: Modifying the index mode and retrieval mode may affect applications associated with this Knowledge.

env.envDescription: Environment variables can be used to store private information and credentials. They are read-only and can be separated from the DSL file during export.

chatVariable.panelDescription: Conversation Variables are used to store interactive information that LLM needs to remember, including conversation history, uploaded files, user preferences. They are read-write.

blocksAbout.start: Define the initial parameters for launching a workflow
blocksAbout.end: Define the end and result type of a workflow
blocksAbout.answer: Define the reply content of a chat conversation
blocksAbout.llm: Invoking large language models to answer questions or process natural language
blocksAbout.knowledge-retrieval: Allows you to query text content related to user questions from the Knowledge
blocksAbout.question-classifier: Define the classification conditions of user questions, LLM can define how the conversation progresses based on the classification description
blocksAbout.if-else: Allows you to split the workflow into two branches based on if/else conditions
blocksAbout.code: Execute a piece of Python or NodeJS code to implement custom logic
blocksAbout.template-transform: Convert data to string using Jinja template syntax
blocksAbout.http-request: Allow server requests to be sent over the HTTP protocol
blocksAbout.variable-assigner: Aggregate multi-branch variables into a single variable for unified configuration of downstream nodes.
blocksAbout.assigner: The variable assignment node is used for assigning values to writable variables(like conversation variables).
blocksAbout.variable-aggregator: Aggregate multi-branch variables into a single variable for unified configuration of downstream nodes.
blocksAbout.iteration: Perform multiple steps on a list object until all results are outputted.
blocksAbout.parameter-extractor: Use LLM to extract structured parameters from natural language for tool invocations or HTTP requests.
blocksAbout.document-extractor: Used to parse uploaded documents into text content that is easily understandable by LLM.
blocksAbout.list-operator: Used to filter or sort array content.

panel.addNextStep: Add the next block in this workflow
panel.checklistTip: Make sure all issues are resolved before publishing

parameterExtractor.instructionTip: Input additional instructions to help the parameter extractor understand how to extract parameters.

parameterExtractor.isSuccess: Is Success.On success the value is 1, on failure the value is 0.

iteration.deleteDesc: Deleting the iteration node will delete all child nodes
iteration.parallelModeEnableDesc: In parallel mode, tasks within iterations support parallel execution. You can configure this in the properties panel on the right.
iteration.parallelPanelDesc: In parallel mode, tasks in the iteration support parallel execution.
iteration.MaxParallelismDesc: The maximum parallelism is used to control the number of tasks executed simultaneously in a single iteration.
iteration.answerNodeWarningDesc: Parallel mode warning: Answer nodes, conversation variable assignments, and persistent read/write operations within iterations may cause exceptions.

apps.title: Explore Apps by Dify
apps.description: Use these template apps instantly or customize your own apps based on the templates.

errorMsg.urlError: url should start with http:// or https://

params.temperatureTip: Controls randomness: Lowering results in less random completions. As the temperature approaches zero, the model will become deterministic and repetitive.
params.top_pTip: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling: 0.5 means half of all likelihood-weighted options are considered.
params.presence_penaltyTip:
How much to penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far.
Increases the model"s likelihood to talk about new topics.
params.frequency_penaltyTip:
How much to penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far.
Decreases the model"s likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.
params.max_tokensTip:
Used to limit the maximum length of the reply, in tokens. 
Larger values may limit the space left for prompt words, chat logs, and Knowledge. 
It is recommended to set it below two-thirds
gpt-4-1106-preview, gpt-4-vision-preview max token (input 128k output 4k)
params.maxTokenSettingTip: Your max token setting is high, potentially limiting space for prompts, queries, and data. Consider setting it below 2/3.
params.setToCurrentModelMaxTokenTip: Max token is updated to the 80% maximum token of the current model {{maxToken}}.
params.stop_sequencesTip: Up to four sequences where the APIÂ will stop generating further tokens. TheÂ returned text will not contain the stopÂ sequence.

systemReasoningModel.tip: Set the default inference model to be used for creating applications, as well as features such as dialogue name generation and next question suggestion will also use the default inference model.

embeddingModel.tip: Set the default model for document embedding processing of the Knowledge, both retrieval and import of the Knowledge use this Embedding model for vectorization processing. Switching will cause the vector dimension between the imported Knowledge and the question to be inconsistent, resulting in retrieval failure. To avoid retrieval failure, please do not switch this model at will.

speechToTextModel.tip: Set the default model for speech-to-text input in conversation.

ttsModel.tip: Set the default model for text-to-speech input in conversation.

rerankModel.tip: Rerank model will reorder the candidate document list based on the semantic match with  user query, improving the results of semantic ranking
